website_summaries.verdict: This ladder comes as a part of an accessory kit which does a good job of upgrading your trampoline.
pros: Comes with a  bag for shoes
Includes stakes for helping to hold your trampoline to the ground
cons: Ladder is a little high for some trampolines and may extend at an awkward angle

customer_reviews.title: Really great kit!
customer_reviews.text: This was a really great kit for the price. Everything we needed to enjoy our new trampoline. After reading a couple of reviews saying how uncomfortable the rods to the ladder were I bought a pool noodle from the dollar store, cut it to the size of the rods, and placed them on each rod. It worked like a charm and all the kids can climb up and down without hurting their feet. Even my 2 year old has no problem using the ladder. The anchors seem really strong and the bonus net for the shoes worked well to keep the yard tidy. I would definitely recommend this kit,especially because buying everything separate would cost alot more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: So this is a pretty well built trampoline ladder. Only issue i had was they sent me some random bolt that was too short so i had to run to lowes and get the correct size to finish the assemble. My daughter complained about it being cold and hurting her feet so i added some foam padding and now she has no issues with climbing up and down. And getting the little shoe holder was a nice bonus but it kept slipping off so i used zip ties to secure it, now there are no issues. Even with tiny flaws i would still recommend. Assemble took less than 5 mins
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Too long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with my 11 foot Skywalker Trampoline. They are way to long. I did not know trampolines came in different heights. I thought getting the same brand name would ensure that it would be a good fit. I was wrong I need a shorter ladder. Be sure to measure to ensure that these are the ones that will fit your particular trampoline. Unsure if I can return after it has been assembled.
customer_reviews.author: kw

customer_reviews.title: Shoe tidy and stakes good, ladder bad
customer_reviews.text: The shoe holder and stakes are great but the ladder itself seems to be not exactly right. For one, its at too shallow an angle when installed and my kids have to climb up at a 45 degree angle instead of the angle in the thumbnail. Also, the fact you have to use a trampoline without shoes means you're climbing this without shoes, maybe without socks. It's actually sore to climb in bare feet because the bars are thin and solid metal. Plastic wrapping or some padding here would be really great. I'm also concerned about my kids exiting the trampoline onto this bare metal thing that sticks out a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have spent more $ and got the ladder with the nice plastic steps on each wrung
customer_reviews.text: The ladder hurts the kids feet when they get on and off. I wish I would have spent more $ and got the ladder with the nice plastic steps on each wrung. Other than that, the ladder at least does what it is supposed to do. It's not like it's cheap and crappy or anything like that. Just that the kids try to avoid stepping on it on the way out of the tramp and sort or jump down because they complain it hurts too much.
customer_reviews.author: lowkey

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: it has been helpful. The bags become the garbage can which is ok. At least the trash is not floating around the backyard and the kids can empty it easy enough. The ladder....it hurts their feet because the rungs are small like little curtain rods. Wish they were more like steps...maybe the kids would slip as much coming down or going up.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa K.

customer_reviews.title: If the steps would have been wider or a bigger diameter it would have been more comfortable on the feet
customer_reviews.text: The ladder hurts to climb. If the steps would have been wider or a bigger diameter it would have been more comfortable on the feet. We don't use the shoe holder. The kids kick their shoes off well before they reach the trampoline. I don't like that to attach the holder to the trampoline you have to tie two pieces of fabric around the metal of the trampoline. We use the stakes because it can get windy where we live. I like that there is a reinforced section to hammer and not compromise the stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob W

customer_reviews.title: Fits Great! Keeps everything Neat!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because "santa" bought a trampoline for my two boys and I wanted a way for them to get easily in and out and somewhere to put their shoes. The trampoline I bought did not come with anything which I'm pretty sure most don't, so I searched Amazon for something and this worked out perfect. The price was reasonable and it fit perfectly on trampoline. It's holding up well but shoe holder is sagging a little but still holds in shoes perfectly and ladder and stakes are not rusting. I would recommend this to anyone who's organized like me and needs everything in its right place.
customer_reviews.author: SJBoyMom

customer_reviews.title: We cut up a pool noodle and taped it around each rung to make it more comfortable, which definitely helps
customer_reviews.text: The stakes seem to work well, though our backyard doesn't get too windy, so I don't know how much we really need them. The ladder works, though it hurts my feet to walk on it. We cut up a pool noodle and taped it around each rung to make it more comfortable, which definitely helps.
customer_reviews.author: Diane B.

customer_reviews.title: Worst ladder ever! Hurts so bad!
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is the worst! Not only did it come with missing pieces it hurt so terribly to climb. Hurts your feet like nothing I’ve ever felt. My kids didn’t want to tell me because they thought they couldn’t use the trampoline anymore. The bars are so skinny that there is no room to grip your feet and they feel like they are ripping your foot in two pieces. Any parent who is leaving positive comments DID NOT try to climb it themselves! I can guarantee if they did try to they’d be writing a similar review. I returned this immediately and ordered a different one!
customer_reviews.author: MomLife

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: the instructions were incorrect on simply tying. these are like ratchet type ties without the ratchet. so you have to thread correctly for the bag to hold shoes etc. the ladder was simple to build and latch on, and at first i was skeptical on anchors but there is absolutely no way this trampoline is moving. i'd buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Luevano

customer_reviews.title: The shoe holder and ladder are great. We added pool noodles to make the steps ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoe holder and ladder are great. We added pool noodles to make the steps thicker for little feet. I can't imagine the stakes holding down much on a really windy day. I wish the stakes had some more meat behind it or something spiral to really grab into the ground. It'll do the job but if we get a big wind storm, I'll be looking for some temporary sand bags just to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin & Karin

customer_reviews.title: The kit was complete and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe a ladder does not come with the trampoline. What was the manufacturer thinking??? We all know the answer to that question. The kit was complete and easy to assemble. The rungs on the ladder are small in diameter and were hard for my grand-kids to climb in bare feet. So I looked online and saw that others had used foam pipe insulation to cover the rungs. It really helps but after a while they become loose. I used Gorilla glue on the rungs and then reattached the insulation. Kids love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for strong winds!
customer_reviews.text: The stakes are huge! I’m confident that they will hold the trampoline during strong winds. My parents trampoline flipped onto their fence and ruined it during a storm and I don’t want that happening to my new fence. I feel this is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: JLH1985

customer_reviews.title: The steps are terrible. They are too narrow
customer_reviews.text: The steps are terrible. They are too narrow, we are not using them; I bought another set of steps that are wide. The number of stakes to anchor the trampoline should have equaled the number of beams on the ground, there are six not four. But only four stakes are provided, and this accessory package I believe is made by the same company as the trampoline. Why wouldn't they provide six stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Lakesha

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this trampoline ladder. It is a great price and very easy to assemble and install. The accessory bag and wind stakes are also easy to install. It is so much easier for my kids to get on the trampoline now.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great trampoline, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Great trampoline for the price, looks great. The ladder is a bit ehh...the kids don't like climbing without shoes on because the steps are metal rods that did in pretty good. but other that that sturdy trampoline. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Tavalos27

customer_reviews.title: This arrived fast and was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This arrived fast and was easy to put together. The ladder will hold some weight but I would worry if you were over 150. At my weight it felt a bit wobbly. Since it's rained non stop here for weeks it was so easy to put the pegs in the ground using just the side of a regular hammer. I like that they are long, much longer than at the local store. The plastic buckles for the storage bag straps don't work the way you are supposed to use a friction buckle because the nylon straps are so thin, so I just tied them in a knot. Overall a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: LADDER IS AWFUL AND DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is SO dangerous. More dangerous than any of the rest of the trampoline setup. The rungs are way too narrow to comfortably support a foot, especially one without a shoe. The rungs are also super slippery. We have had more accidents of kids slipping and falling through between the rungs than anything else. It's more dangerous than just having no ladder at all.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great way the get the kids onto the trampoline
customer_reviews.text: Great way the get the kids onto the trampoline. Only issue came when the plastic feet fell off and when we slide the ladder onto the trampoline it ripped the cover. Find a better way to affix the rubber and you'd have an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: looks nice and fits great but, Ouch.. hard on the feet!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to be used with the Skywalker Trampoline (12 ft) It fits perfectly but its really hard on your feet to climb it. the rungs are very narrow and its quite painful to climb up. It also came with a bolt for one of the rungs that was not threaded so i had to go buy a new one at the hardware store. I've read other reviews that say use a pool noodle to pad it and I will be trying that otherwise i my have to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G

customer_reviews.title: THAT's a good ladder!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, aside from the needing a pair of pliers to tighten the screws/nuts. Love the stakes and the netting it came with. Doesn't seem like ladder will break anytime soon! Very strong metal.
customer_reviews.author: mistersnappyp

customer_reviews.title: Stakes = good. Ladder = painful.
customer_reviews.text: First of all the metal wind stakes deserve a 5 star rating. These things appear to be able to hold down a trampoline in a hurricane. The ladder is 3 stars. Did the person who designed tiny, round ladder rungs actually test this out? Who can step on tiny, round metal rungs? It's like some sort of endurance torture test trying to use this ladder. I feel like I'm on an episode of the ninja warrior show. Except without the athleticism and spandex. Do your feet a favor and find a ladder with flat rungs.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherEK

customer_reviews.title: Trampoline Accessories Pack
customer_reviews.text: We bought a 12 ft trampoline and I figured this would be a nice accessory pack to have. The ladder is thin and it hurts your feet when you go on it but it serves it's purpose, to climb into and down from the trampoline. The stakes are good to have so that while you're jumping, the trampoline doesn't move and shift around. The bag is nice to have as well so that shoes and things don't get thrown around. All in all, a good set of accessories to have for a big trampoline. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Flores

customer_reviews.title: ... bars were I would've just bought a step stool like my sister in the first place
customer_reviews.text: Honestly if I knew how skinny the bars were I would've just bought a step stool like my sister in the first place. It's really painful stepping up & down the ladder and my kids sometimes have trouble finding steps on their way down. Can't vouch for stakes as we haven't put them in quite yet
customer_reviews.author: Shernicole

customer_reviews.title: More preference than necessity.
customer_reviews.text: This is more of a preference buy. I don't know that my trampoline is light enough to fly away in average storms. I probably could've came up with something just as creative to anchor it on my own. The ladder is outright painful to climb up if you're any older than 3. I'd suggest something with some padding. The shoe pockets, again, are a matter of preference, but we used them the first time around and not once since.
customer_reviews.author: N.A.R.

customer_reviews.title: Good for sawing your feet in half, HORRIBLE for getting on the trampoline, BIG waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Most people jump on the trampoline with socks or bare feet, well this is a nice little torture device for you to use getting on or off of your trampoline. The bars are so thin that they dig into your feet and hurt! Also the incline of the steps once attached is steep, the kids have already slipped off the ladder several times and really hurt themselves. So bad that we threw it out and are using a chair until the new ladder arrives. Don't waste your money like I did.
customer_reviews.author: M. Broadbent

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fits great on our 14ft trampoline Perfect my kids love it so much easier to get on and off the trampoline i have a 3,7 and 10 yr old. Easy to put up i did it myself in less than 15 mins
customer_reviews.author: Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: HELPS for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Great from your trampoline. My kids would struggle to get on and off the trampoline and since I got them this... the LOVE that they can get on and off by themselves. (7 & 5) the side net is also nice for toys and shoes so things dont get lost. Not sure how long it will last becasue you can tell its made with cheap material but no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon & Sara

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My trampoline has been through many storms this season. It is still standing. The ladder does hurt your feet. The kids seem ok with it.
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a great package and definitely needed for anybody with a trampoline
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great package and definitely needed for anybody with a trampoline. I just wish that it wasn't so painful to walk up the steps. They should either make the steps flat or include some type of foam that you can put around it. I think I need to buy a pool noodle and cut it to size and zip tie it to the steps. Otherwise it is too uncomfortable for anybody, adults and kids complain about the pain...
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for roughly 2 years now and it has held up so well!! So happy I got this! The steps are a little rough so we just taped pool noodles on them and it has held up so good!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Hesson

customer_reviews.title: I like it fine
customer_reviews.text: I like it fine. I just wish there were actual steps to walk on instead of bars. I couldn't find any like that so I got this one. Then I saw my friend had found one with steps for her trampoline. It was also a hassle to put together.
customer_reviews.author: elmo247

customer_reviews.title: We love this and our kids do too
customer_reviews.text: We love this and our kids do too! The tramp was high enough that the younger kids could not climb up without help, but they now are able to get on by themselves. The product quality is excellent and the assembly only took 5-10 minutes. This is a very simple but effective necessity for anyone with a trampoline. Tip - cut a foam pool noodle and put a piece on each ladder rung in order to increase climbing comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Allred's In Utah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: It’s super easy to put together and seems to be pretty sturdy. I docked one star because the box was beat up pretty badly and the hardware for the ladder itself was rolling around on the inside as the bag that held was torn somewhere along the line.
customer_reviews.author: Trav

customer_reviews.title: Good but too hard for
customer_reviews.text: Great product very sturdy however the ladder is too hard and made my kids feet hurt. Also not good for kids when getting wet. We have an attachment that wets the trampoline and my nephew fell because of the slick ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew  luna

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so our little one could climb up on the trampoline herself and the stakes help because we live in the midwest where it can get windy! I will say though, I am not sure why Skywalker only gives you 4 stakes...when their trampoline has 6 legs. I would have preferred one for each leg just to be safe. Overall easy to install and put together, no complaints and nothing has broken.
customer_reviews.author: jsandvold

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed, unsafe ladder
customer_reviews.text: The mesh bag for shoes is ok, but pretty small. My main concern is the ladder. Sure, it fits into the trampoline but the rungs are very slick and very thin (think above ground pool ladder). Without being extremely careful it would be entirely too easy for a kid to slip and bust a few teeth out. We will have to modify this with grip tape to keep feet on the rings but I can make them any wider. It's a bad design and would be better if it were more stair like.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a must have accessory pack with your trampoline.....the price is right on point! Everything arrived on time and as stated in the post. Couldn’t be happier
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: Simple as 1-2-3. Sturdy and seems to be made of decent materials minus the nuts and screws that come with the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Daddys Profile

customer_reviews.title: Great add on for any trampoline!
customer_reviews.text: The ladder is SO NICE to have will little ones around. Our 4-year-old can get on and off the trampoline easily and safely. Some other reviewers have mentioned the round latter rungs being painful on little feet. So far we haven't heard this complaint. The stakes are heavy-duty and long enough to make a difference (way heftier than they look in the photo). The bag is nice but, c'mon, these are kids. They just throw their stuff wherever. I suppose it's nice for the grown-ups to have a safe place to stash an iPhone or wallet while we jump.
customer_reviews.author: chad.w

customer_reviews.title: Worth it all for the price
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is helpful for my 5 and 2 year old. I just wish the bars were a little wider because it hurts going up it in bare feet. My girls wait to take their shoes off until after they go up it. Then they bend over the edge to put their shoes in the handy net. Was worth all of it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great product... went from a 15'.
customer_reviews.text: When to a 12' from a 15'. Need to put this in a dedicated area of my yard and the 15' was just too much. My kids and neighbors LOVE it. It was easy to assemble BUT do watch the video and pay attention BEFORE attaching the net. Looks great and the kids love it. Get the ladder kit too. Well well worth it!! It completes the set.
customer_reviews.author: digitalPimple

customer_reviews.title: Their trampoline is nice but do not waste your money on this kit
customer_reviews.text: Their trampoline is nice but do not waste your money on this kit. The ladder is awful, too long and hardly useable. The little storage nets are not necessary. I only bought it for the hold down hooks but if you have a drill and a couple of heavy duty long nails, a hole in the bottom tube and the nails will work as well. My ground is very hard and dry since I live in Arizona so I had to pre-drill the ground anyway to get the stakes in.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jansen

customer_reviews.title: Great products
customer_reviews.text: This was so awesome! I love the accessory kit that amazon suggested. The ladder is super durable and the shoe met is perfect! I also liked the stakes, very heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: AshKris

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for shoe bag or stakes...
customer_reviews.text: Ladder is great, shoe bag is kind of worthless, and you definitely need additional anchoring devices besides these four stakes if you live anywhere that gets winds or gusts over 30 mph.
customer_reviews.author: Lance V.

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 3 products great
customer_reviews.text: The ladder is great, and the steaks work well... The shoe net thing doesn't stay up. Every time the kids out anything in it, it drops to the ground. I've tried using the clips but they don't stay up. I'm sure I can try tie it some how but I would expect it to work the way it was advertised. Also the net is low, and hard for the kids to reach, even if it did stay up.
customer_reviews.author: NHirschfelt

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy in and out for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Steps make access easy for littler ones without ripping up trampoline surrounds. Used sections of a purple foam pool noodle, secured with zip ties, over ladder rungs so they were softer on the feet (purple matches our purple trampoline, got noodle idea from another who left feedback on here before I purchased). Great purchase, well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: E. Cooney

customer_reviews.title: Painful and slippery
customer_reviews.text: I loved the spikes to hold the trampoline down. We HATE the ladder. It's painful on your feet and very slippery if it gets wet. It was easy to assemble and hang on the trampoline but if I had known it'd be this painful on the feet, I definitely would have selected a different set.
customer_reviews.author: Caiapfas

customer_reviews.title: The wind stakes are very sturdy and worth it
customer_reviews.text: The wind stakes are very sturdy and worth it! However, the ladder is quite lightweight and hurts my kids feet. Total design flaw! The storage bag is worthless if you ask me. It's flimsy, doesn't stay attached, and is not sectioned off to be of any use.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Nice ladder
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have. Especially for smaller kids. Very easy to put together and is very sturdy. I was worried it was going to slide back and forth, but it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Elliot

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: This is well worth the money and I have already had a number or friends ask where we got it wanting their own. The stakes are GREAT, a must have in our area, and have already sustained winds at 40 mph. The ladder will hold an adult with no problems. We don't really use the shoe net all that much, but it does get used from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trampoline ladder
customer_reviews.text: The kids complained that they rungs were slippery, my son put foam pipe insulation around them and are fine
customer_reviews.author: daria leibach

customer_reviews.title: ACESS  TO A GOOD JUMP
customer_reviews.text: Kit worked well, wished it would have came with 2 more hold downs. Shoe holder velcro was a waste. ended up tieing it, longer ties would have been nice and worked better. Velcro didn't hold in strong wind.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: ladder works very well and is sturdy to ensure little ones get in and out safely
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, everyone who owns a trampoline should purchase one.
customer_reviews.text: Best thing needed to add to a trampoline. It’s great!! Don’t have to worry about kids trying to safely get in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Griffin

customer_reviews.title: It'd be fine for lighter folks (under 180 pounds
customer_reviews.text: We had this thing a week and it fell off the trampoline. I ended up knotting the idiot straps and then the net started pulling away from the straps. Not worth the money. The ladder works but if you're at all heavy it's rough to climb up. It feels somewhat unbalanced and flimsy. It'd be fine for lighter folks (under 180 pounds, I'd say) and kids. The stakes do their job well. Trampoline hasn't flown off yet, despite high winds.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy HarrisTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It is somewhat painful to walk up with no shoes
customer_reviews.text: The ladder is too tall for our trampoline. Perhaps that is my fault for not making sure I was getting a ladder the appropriate height. The circumference of the ladder steps is too small. It is somewhat painful to walk up with no shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Allen

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and now kids are safer getting into the trampoline.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why everyone is complaining about the ladder?? It was just perfect for our 15' Skywalker trampoline! I don't feel the need to make any alterations to it like everyone is talking about... fine the way it is.
customer_reviews.author: hjlt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: Everything works very well. We got everything on the same day, the latter was easy to assemble, the net helps keep the kids shoes all organized, and tje steaks are long enough to help hold the trampoline in place. This was a good bundle for us.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice little addition to the trampoline my 7 yo is on the shorter side, it’s a god send to him 🤗
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't gonna buy these for the trampoline but we had tornadoes come thru this area, other people's trampoline was in the road, trees, neighbor's yard but my trampoline was still in the place I put it. This is a must, for anyone living in an area, with known bad weather
customer_reviews.author: Retro

customer_reviews.title: An amazing and well worth it attachment
customer_reviews.text: The ladder/pegs/shoe holder net combo is a great investment for any trampoline. The actual "tie downs/pegs) are sturdy and brace the trampoline(with enclosure) outstandingly. We had extreme winds that were moving ALL things around but my trampoline didn't even slide thanks to the pegs. The net compartment that attaches around the bars with velcro is a great place to put shoes so no one has to touch the ground before being able to get their shoes. There is also a smaller compartment in the net that we store our glasses, cell phones, etc .. The ladder is the only thing that requires assembly but is super easy only a few nuts and bolts but is extremely sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straight forward. My 12 year old put it together in about 5 minutes and it's perfect - exactly like it says.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It's a ladder and and anchor kit - it works
customer_reviews.text: The ladder fits perfectly and suits my needs. As some other reviewers stated, the rungs on the ladder are hard of bare feet; however, I think there are solutions to the problem so it's not a deal breaker. The net is a nice addition to store shoes and other miscellaneous items. Everything is of good quality and seems to be pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mauka

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Just as others have mentioned the ladder is a little long. However I pushed the poles go into the ground which made the ladder the correct height.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect assessor pack for our trampoline
customer_reviews.text: Perfect assessor pack for our trampoline. Some users weren't impressed with the ladder. I can't say it has grips or that it has wide bars for better foot access... but I can say my 2 year old uses it and gets up and down the trampoline just fine. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: The stakes seem fine, but the ladder was a problem to assemble ...
customer_reviews.text: The stakes seem fine, but the ladder was a problem to assemble and uncomfortable. The assembly the nuts were too close to the welds and I had a problem getting a good grip on the nuts. The rungs are round and narrow and hurt bare feet. I tought of buying a pool noodle and wrapping the rungs and after browsing other comments on the product, that is exactly what other have done.
customer_reviews.author: Grease Spot

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Goes great with our trampoline! The accessory net didn't stay on the trampoline as well as we would have liked however- maybe you will have better luck, we do have a lot of wind where we live which is why we wanted the stakes- those work great. The ladder is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: A to Z for Moms Like Me

customer_reviews.title: Not included
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for going the extra mile and not including this in your already overpriced trampoline.
customer_reviews.author: MadDad

customer_reviews.title: I made an excellent choice with this one
customer_reviews.text: I made an excellent choice with this one! It's still holding up very well after a year and my kids are getting lots of exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Downy Fresh

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder
customer_reviews.text: Gear ladder etc... instructions incorrect for the shoe bag included besides that good deal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Makes getting in and out a breeze. Nice and sturdy. I am 200lbs and I use it daily with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K

customer_reviews.title: The basket is useful for putting toy items the kids play with on ...
customer_reviews.text: The basket is useful for putting toy items the kids play with on the trampoline. The stakes work pretty well. The ladder is just okay. It hurts to climb up. I bought a noodle and cut it to put around the steps and it helps a little but they turn around which also makes it difficult to climb up. It works though.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Benavides

customer_reviews.title: The ladder was very easy to put together and is easy to put on ...
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who has a trampoline this is a must buy! The ladder was very easy to put together and is easy to put on and off. The stakes work great! We live in an area with lots of wind multiple neighbors have lost their trampolines but ours has not budged. I am so happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Terra Marie

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a trampoline
customer_reviews.text: Nice add on for the trampoline. My kids are 8 and 10 and I considered not buying a ladder, but it really helps.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent accessory kit for the trampoline
customer_reviews.text: This cat had hooks to steak the trampoline into the ground, a net to tied to the trampoline to hold the shoes as well as a ladder. The quality was excellent, the instructions made it easy and I now feel like my trampoline is safe and secure
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A Long

customer_reviews.title: Product was well made
customer_reviews.text: Product was purchased as an accessory for a trampoline I purchased my granddaughter for Christmas. My daughter indicates that it was a real help in getting onto and off the trampoline. Purchasers of trampolines should really consider buying this product as an accessory to an trampoline purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Moser

customer_reviews.title: Accessory kit is great. Wind stakes have kept our trampoline in place ...
customer_reviews.text: Accessory kit is great. Wind stakes have kept our trampoline in place with no issues despite several days of heavy winds. Ladder is functional but uncomfortable, as others have noted but super quick fix of adding pool noodles to the treads fixed it right up.
customer_reviews.author: Navygrrrl76

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for all trampolines!
customer_reviews.text: The tie downs and the ladder are a must for all trampolines. Honestly I think they should be included with the trampoline and enclosure since it's a safety hazard to not have either one of these items. Nonetheless, this is a great buy at a good price!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Loved these extras for my nieces trampoline. The shoe net makes it a lot easier to keep things from getting lost when you have a bunch of kids jumping and running around. Ladder is a must have - getting in and out of the trampoline is hard enough with the ladder - near impossible without thanks to the netting.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Ouch.
customer_reviews.text: The rungs of the ladder are so small, the kids are complaining that it hurts their feet when they climb onto the trampoline with their socks on or in their bare feet. Going to have to see if I can safely add slats to the ladder, to make it more similar to a pool ladder.
customer_reviews.author: mcali17

customer_reviews.title: Works great, tried and test!
customer_reviews.text: Live in Colorado Springs and have had some wind storms that have come through and our trampoline stayed put when others were blown away and seen wrapped around poles and fences throughout the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Mace H

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars except the original delivery was missing several parts so we weren't able to attach it to the trampoline for Christmas morning. :-( The replacement did arrive a few days later with all parts intact.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Everything in this kit works great except the anchors
customer_reviews.text: Everything in this kit works great except the anchors, they are worthless. Don't depend on the anchors in this kit to be your tie down solution
customer_reviews.author: Woody Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I received a package with no instructions or hardware. My kid cried! Worst experience ever.
customer_reviews.author: HBMommy14

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for little kids
customer_reviews.text: Terrible for little kids. The steps are super small. My 3 year old and his friends fall off it all the time. Had to take off because was afraid of them was really going to get hurt
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: One of two boxes that arrived was badly beaten and ...
customer_reviews.text: One of two boxes that arrived was badly beaten and tapped up on both ends and there were still holes in it and u could see the contents inside. When putting it together I was short one spring and the foam padding that goes on the bars was ripped but other than that it's a decent trampoline.
customer_reviews.author: KenH

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to the trampoline
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, feels very sturdy. Very happy 4 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Good for cost
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ladder for little ones. Sturdy for what it is but just leans into the trampoline
customer_reviews.author: Lopez913

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Just what we were looking for, our trampoline is on the top of a hill and gets hit by lots of wind, the tie downs are long almost as long as my fore arm, so I do not see it getting blown into the neighbors yard. The ladder let's my little ones climb in and out without help. The shoe bag, I am currently having trouble keeping it hooked to the trampoline. I think I am hooking it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Zombiemomma25

customer_reviews.title: My kids did not like this
customer_reviews.text: The steps hurt my kids feet when going up and down the ladder so I had to buy a different ladder.... it is easy to put together and sturdy if that is all you care about
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Besides a minor shipping error this thing is great. Our child had been just climbing the edge but this has allowed him so much more flexibility getting on and off the trampoline.
customer_reviews.author: emery ray sanders

customer_reviews.title: Hours and hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Our grandkids absolutely love this. My husband and older kids were easily able to assemble it. So many hours of fun day after day for the grandkids!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy M.

customer_reviews.title: ... to get on to the trampoline but it is pretty small and we put some padding (like pool noodles) ...
customer_reviews.text: You need this to get on to the trampoline but it is pretty small and we put some padding (like pool noodles) on the steps so they were less painful to step on. I still feel like I'd recommend it because again you need it to get up on the trampoline and I didn't really feel like experimenting with other possibilities.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: The anchor kit has held the trampoline tightly down through many storms and the ladder makes it very easy for my kids to access
customer_reviews.text: We live out on acres and my land is not fenced in, with heavy winds that come through I was worried our trampoline wouldn't last very long. The anchor kit has held the trampoline tightly down through many storms and the ladder makes it very easy for my kids to access the trampoline without us constantly having to help. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always holds down my trampoline!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set for my daughter's trampoline. I thought of it since the trampoline never came with any anchors or any accessories at all. The ladder works great; really helps my daughter climb into the trampoline. The netting is perfect for her shoes as well. The anchors kept the trampoline held down even through a hurricane!! I highly recommend this for any trampoline!
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW

customer_reviews.title: Great Trampoline Ladder
customer_reviews.text: Younger family members would always struggle to get in / out of the trampoline on their own. While this ladder looks really basic in design, it definitely gets the job done - and now all of our kids are able to get in / out of the trampoline when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene O.

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids to safely enter the trampoline.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it prevents falls and has storage for shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrold A. Taylor II

product_meta.title: Skywalker Trampolines 3-Rung Ladder Accessory Kit
product_meta.description: Make your trampoline even more secure with the Skywalker Trampolines 3-Rung Ladder Accessory Kit! This accessory kit includes a trampoline ladder, a shoe storage bag, and 4 wind stakes. The trampoline ladder is made of weather-resistant galvanized steel, and easily hooks onto your trampoline for quick installation. The shoe storage bag is convenient for storing loose articles, and easily attaches to your trampoline. The four 12.5" long wind stakes are constructed of weather-resistant galvanized steel, and will help stabilize your trampoline during strong winds and storms. This accessory kit is the perfect addition to any trampoline!
feature_bullets: FITS: trampoline rails up to 4 Inches in diameter. Easy to install
MATERIALS: Ladder is made of weather and rust resistant galvanized steel
FEATURES: Shoe bag attaches to the side of the trampoline for convenient storage
SAFETY DESIGN: 4 wind stakes help anchor the trampoline to the ground, fit any trampoline with leg diameter up to 2 inches
